inn1.comm: wide and slashed with real venom to the right of the diving cover point
short and Nafees jagged out of the line at the last moment. A good response and proof that with some effort there is life in this track
slightly wide and left alone
banged in and an unconvincing defensive parry which lobbed up but not near enough any fielders to be of interest
too wide, and a slightly uncontrolled slash which is nevertheless hit well and  stopped by a diving cover
Bradshaw hits the right line and length from the off and Ashraful plays a textbook defensive shot
just coming back in to the right-hander and again safely blocked
full length and no chance to get that away
drifting to leg and worked down to long leg for a single
on Nafees's off stump and a rather hurried defensive jab ... it kept a bit low which surprised the batsman more than the pace
worked wide of mid-on for an easy single
slashed in the air but a few yards short of fine leg and despite some excitement in the crowd, it was never a catch
kicked up from a length around off stump, Nafees shuffles across and pushed to point
again in the channel outside off, punched off the back foot to point
fuller and outside off, drawing Nafees into a drive and he steers it past backward point for a single
wide down the leg side
almost caught and bowled. It was fullish, on middle stump and Ashraful ended up playing a strange scoop shot inches to the right of Taylor
in the channel outside off, pushed to point
greedy chase outside off stump, couldn't reach to it though
turned to leg but with no power
played out to point
Bradshaw in a nice rhythm here, giving Nafees nothing to play with
Nafees can do nothing but push it into the covers, completing a maiden over
straight, turned Ashraful square as he pushed it defensively back
poor shot. It was not nearly short enough for the pull Ashraful attempted and the ball skidded through and gave Billy Bowden one of his simpler decisions
nicely clipped wide of midwicket, timed beautifully and a great way to get off the mark
a bit more hurried, pushed into the covers off the back foot
pushed through at 90mph and an ambitious pull shot - especially third ball up - but the ball was through him be the time he played it
again some venom in that one one to complete a good over
Bradshaw continues his hold over Nafees with a seventh straight dot ball
Nafees, looking increasingly frustrated, tries to pull a ball that's just not there for the shot and it dribbles nowhere
tries to steer the ball to third man but straight to a fielder
finally, at the 10th time of asking, he finds the gap with a slash to third man
that one was more leg-side and flicked with ease to deep square leg for the single. But another good over from Bradshaw
done for pace - he jabbed down and just kept it out. Taylor is considerably quicker than Bradshaw and that surprised Aftab
overpitched and driven hard into the ground, but it has the legs to run all the way to the long-on boundary
aimed to hit over the top, mistimed but it lobbed safely into spaces on the leg side
that was a cracker. Short and pulled with power to the delight of a partisan crowd
short and Aftab got in a bit of a muddle as it stuck the back of his bat but fortunately for him it went into his body and to safety
dropped!   Hooked in the air straight to Samuels at long leg ... he was racing in from the boundary, but was moving too quickly and parried the ball over the ropes to add insult to injury
wide, slashed and missed
back on the right line, nothing there for the batsman
wide, but even less pace than usual and it barely got off the ground, leaving Nafees groping at air&
missed attempted leg-side flick. Again, the complete lack of pace did him, showing the value of a bowler who can put it on the spot at a little over medium
at last Nafees gets one through the ring. Bradshaw drifted to leg and it was sweetly clipped away
after the snail, back to the hare. Taylor on off stump and no chance of  Aftab doing anything other than blocking it
outside off stump and Aftab not interested
he had to play that one but nothing more than a pat back to the bowler
slightly  more width, still no chance of attacking it though
Aftab's patience exhausted, he takes a step down the pitch and aims a real heave, but it comes off the toe and bobbles back to Taylor
leg side to spoil a good over
Taylor pulls it in short and Aftab gets a top edge which flies about 10 yards over the fine-leg boundary
pushed into the covers for an easy one
close to a wide and well taken by Baugh

flicked by Aftab  from in front of him, airbourne for six over square leg ... but only inches and if Jermone Taylor had been on the fence it would have been down his throat. But he was three yards in and he could only wave it past
Good reply from Bradshaw
on the button
a good end to the over, and Baugh standing up adds to the pressure on the batsman
right on the money first-up from the new bowler
full and driveable, but unable to beat the field
shorter and a hint of width, but Shahriar misses out with a wild slash
lovely delivery! Really climbed at the batsman's gloves from a good length, but he flinches out of the way in time
more width this time, but not called
tight onto the pads and jabbed down into the crease. The end of a good probing over
right in the channel, a play-and-miss as the ball seams away from the left-hander
fuller and straighter. No freebies on offer for the Bangladeshis
straight again, and seemed to keep a bit low as well
on the pads this time, and clipped into square leg for a couple
firm push straight past the bowler. Fielded with a dive behind the stumps by mid-on
outside off with the keeper standing up, and an uncertain flat-footed push into the covers
on leg stump, steered off the pads
lovely shot! Easy as you like, a closed-face push down the ground, all the way to the boundary
back on the stumps and dropped into the crease
very tight and full, nothing to work with for the batsman
West Indies are applying the squeeze very effectively now
another good over, just the four runs coming from it
pushed into the covers
a hint of width this time, and a deliberate steer to third man to rotate the strike
lovely full-blooded strike through the covers, and an even better save on the boundary's edge from Chanderpaul who dives full-length for Sarwan to clean up. Good cricket
tighter line
width again, and a semi-genuine edge eludes the man at slip and is picked up on the third-man boundary
a dot ball to finish. Bangladesh are ticking along reasonably well at the moment
firm square-cut, bobbles in front of the fielder at point
full and a hint of inswing, jabbed down into the crease as the batsmen contemplate stealing a run
bosh! That's the shot! A dismissive smear through the covers. There's not a lot of pace on this pitch, and not a lot of room for error either
better line, Shahriar is slightly squared up by a straighter, fuller delivery
once again, room to free his arms, and another whirlwind strike square of the wicket. Slight fielding error gifts a single
and Aftab joins the fun as well - slightly short and outside off, and hoisted gloriously towards cow corner. Bangladesh are enjoying themselves out there!
squirted into the covers
better line
nutmegged! A simple push into the leg-side, and the ball bobbles straight through mid-on's legs!
the lack of pace is forcing Bangladesh to regroup before taking risks
good rhythm so far from Samuels
and that completes a fine first over, as the drinks cart makes another appearance
good wicket-to-wicket line. Strikes the pad but going down leg
picks the gap well, and another couple to the score. Aftab is the key if Bangladesh are to accelerate in these middle overs
a rare short ball, and a hint of an appeal from the keeper
back on a good length, and fenced away outside off stump
once again, a full-length delivery is jabbed down into the crease. Always looks uncomfortable, but seems to be effective.
and another single to finish. Collymore is bowling steadily, but he's not exactly threatening
leg-side, and dabbed into space. Good batting
bat and pad together, pushed into the covers
steady stuff from Samuels
slightly leg-side, and turned away to midwicket
finds the gap this time to tick the score along
and a good, wristy flick into space on the leg-side allows Aftab to keep the strike. Sensible accumulation from the Bangladeshis
exquisite timing from Aftab! Full and slightly too close to leg stump from Collymore, and that's flicked with the wrists clean through square leg
well batted, soft hands and an off-stump delivery is guided cleverly through third man
and another four in the over brings up his seventh ODI fifty! Well batted, this one is swivel-pulled through backward square-leg
better line from Collymore
sensible batting, looking to go onto a big one
and another dot to complete the over
clobbered over midwicket, lovely strike!
better line, but West Indies are starting to get a bit eager for that breakthrough

and that is the breakthrough! Flatter and wider from Samuels, and Shahriar's attempted cut flies firmly through to Chris Gayle at slip. That's the end of a fine innings, but the onus is now on Aftab to make his a big performance&
carefully negotiated to complete the over
clipped to leg for a strolled single
lovely line,  considered playing but withdrew at the last second
Lazy footwork from Hasan, inside edge attempting a loose drive and the balls cannons into his off stump. "That's ****," splutters the Father of Bangladesh Cricket. He has a point

a first-baller to follow his second baller at the weekend. Habibul only half forward and with the bat lurking behind his front pad, not much doubt that that was going on to remove his middle stump. In the space of two balls Bangladesh have gone from looking comfortable to being in the mire
er ... a bouncer wide down the leg side with the hat-trick ball. Not really the most intelligent bowling
back on line and flat-batted to mid on
a foot or so outside off stump but with the way this over has gone Farhad is not going to try anything daft
turned to leg, brief thoughts of a second run but it was never on the cards and that was underlined by a flat throw to the top of the stumps
waited for it and drove along the ground to long on
wristy flick but straight to short midwicket
missed attempted swish to leg but the ball still evaded fielders and allowed scrambled single
nothing doing ... straight to short midwicket again
opened the face and placed it well between fielders
dropped into the leg side, and although the ball only went about 20 yards such was the placement that they ran an easy two and it was Baugh who had to scurry out to field it
a bit wider and he couldn't work that one into the same space
in the corridor, and after the recent flurry of wickets Aftab 's not going to take any risks for the moment
half-controlled edge down to third man
short and Farhad easily ducks under the ball
driven firmly to extra cover
worked to short fine-leg and a scrambled single
tried the same again but this time the fielder was on his toes rather than his heels
pushed up to long on
identikit shot, again pushed up to long on

a soft end to a good innings. Aftab takes a step down the pitch and looks to smack Samuels over the top but it lacks real power and Chanderpaul at long on doesn't have to move to take a regulation catch
Mashud stretches and pushes the ball into the covers
Farhad driven on to the back foot by an extra yard of pace
dropped!  Extra bounce, an outside edge and Baugh diving to his right gets a glove to it but spills it. There is a suspicion that he should have tried to get his other hand to it
opened the face and tried to run into space on the off
nothing doing again. A tight field is putting pressure on
squirted behind square on the leg
driven in the air off the back foot but into a big gap and the man at deep cover keeps them down to a single
right on the spot
Samuels rattling through the overs and giving little away
slightly more adventurous but short midwicket pounces
finally a flick on the leg evades the close field and breaks the stranglehold
a good start, a bit of pace and clatters into Farhad's pads
leg side, off the pads and Baugh quickly round to prevent a single

wide of off stump but Farhad attempts a shot that's part drive, part cut, and completely nothing, lacking any discernable footwork, and a big edge clatters into his stumps.  "What a pony," moans Miller ... among other unprintable comments.
wide of off stump but it shoots along the ground and Baugh left looking silly as it bobbles off his foot
played into the covers
driven firmly  to mid off
delicately steered wide of slip and to the boundary
worked to leg
patted back to the bowler
pushed square to point
same again. Samuels proving hard to get away
this time it's played finer and that allowed the run
took his bottom hand off the bat and it plopped into the leg side
guided to extra cover
a pattern emerging here ... Bravo bowling a steady line and the off-side field doing the rest
slightly straighter, driven to mid off
placed to the left of point for an easy one
another dot ball to end a tight over
driven with conviction to wide long off, placed well enough for them to come back for a second
wristy flick, again well placed up to long on
pushed to point
and once again pushed to point
neatly worked into the gap in the covers
seamed away from the left-hander and Rafique was left groping at air
Rafique left that alone, probably wary after the previous ball
too much width this time and Bowden into action
airy swish, kept low and bounced before reaching Baugh
opens the face and run to wide third man
good length and mid off fields
round the wicket, and floated up onto a length

oh dear, oh dear, Rafique's gone as well! Floated onto leg stump by Gayle, and a tangled sweep shot is adjudged lbw. Not utterly convinced on first viewing by that one, to be honest, but umpire Taufel had no doubts.
an elegant drive through the covers, well fielded on the boundary's edge by Samuels
pushed into space to rotate the strike
wider and just back of a length. Mashud is beaten outside off stump and nearly topples out of his crease as well
turned to leg to finish the over
a bit chancy there - an inside-edge eludes the stumps and results in a scampered single
on the back foot, and steered to point
more tight lines from Bravo - he's bowled very well indeed
outside off, left well alone
full length, right on off stump, uneasy steer to point
wider this time, and again no stroke offered. Solid stuff from Bravo
turned into the leg-side, and easily cleaned up by midwicket
no way through there
edged and dropped! A swish, a thin nick, a despairing dive from slip, and a parry to fine leg for a couple of runs. Lucky!
back on the mark from Gayle
pushed out to the covers
and a single to finish the over. Solid stuff from Gayle as well, but another over negotiated by the Bangladeshis&
steered into the leg-side

What a catch! What a catch! Absolutely astonishing take from Bravo, plucked off his bootlaces, one-handed in his followthrough! Brilliantly athletic and just reward for an excellent spell. He's off on a celebratory lap of the pitch, as Bangladesh's dismal collapse continues
outside off, left well alone
still nothing loose whatsoever from Bravo
tight and tight again
finds the edge this time, and the ball deflects down to third man to complete the over
clipped into the off side
a chip and charge reaps another single
plenty width, clobbered through the covers, lovely strike
solid defensive shot, straight down into the pitch
and more of the same. Another over survived
full and straight, pushed into the covers once again
attempted slower ball, emerges as a loopy full toss, and slap-pushed into the covers
back on Bravo's favoured length, and dabbed away for a single to third man
back of a length, maybe a hint of movement, beats edge
width and left well alone. If this pair can push the total towards 200, there may be something to play for in this match
good stride down the pitch, and a bread-and-butter push down to long-on
dabbed down into the crease, thought about a run
pushed into the off side this time
a smear, pure and simple. But enough bat on it to make it worthwhile
and another single to finish. Sensible batting for the most part, as the score creeps ever onwards
right on the money once again. No freebies here
tight lines, definite hint of swing
one more to the total
there's little these batsmen can do but keep out the good balls and milk the bad. But Bravo's not giving anything away
that's a rarity - speared down leg and rightly called a wide. Bravo looks to the heavens in dismay
but that's better. Right back on his line and length, and watchfully defended
the old stager keeps his head
width, and a bizarre cut shot leaning back to a ball outside off. Effective though
floated up and onto middle and off. No width this time
steady from Razzak. Bangladesh have to play for overs
more of the same
and another tight over
Bravo into his eighth over. Very steady stuff
another slower ball. He has so many variations
fuller and straighter, and a hint of an appeal. Not out, says umpire Bowden
full-length once again, pushed down the ground but no way through the field
shorter, dabbed off the shoulder of the bat to third man

fuller and wider, and out! A big swish of the bat and a thin nick through to the keeper. Enticing the drive and reaping the rewards. Brilliant stuff from Bravo, who has yet to concede a run in front of square, let alone a boundary.
punched off the back foot wide of extra cover, brief thoughts of a second but after much yelling, the batsmen stay put
patted gently back to the bowler
another classic defensive prod
again a gentle non-spinning offbreak plopped away
a quiet end to a soporific over. Bangladesh's main aim now seems to be to bat out the overs
too quick for Mashud. Hits him on the body and squirts out on the leg
marginally short of a length, Mashud drops his hands and thrusts out his chest as the ball flies past his midriff
into the covers, not a sniff of a run
placed between the cover fielders for a single to the man in the deep. That's the first run Bravo has conceded in front of square
Rasel prodded at that with no footwork and it beat his outside edge with something to spare
much the same but half a yard quicker ... and Rasel even further from making contact
back into the same grove. Gayle bowls gently outside the off stump and the ball is dropped into the covers
and again ...
this time a tad shorter and an attempted cut goes straight to extra cover
this time he finds the gap
driven in the air inches over Lara at short cover for a single
Bravo has now beaten Rasel's outside edge three times in succession, and Rasel doesn't look like getting near it
and another one flies past the edge, but it keeps low and any snick would have fallen short
Rasel connects!  An outside edge goes through fourth slip for a single
slightly too full and driven up to long off
another ball roars past Rasel's outside edge
fittingly Bravo finishes his spell by beating Rasel's slashing drive
Mashud dances down the pitch and drives into the off side. That exposes Rasel for five balls ...
Rasel copies his colleague and uses his feet to drive
neatly turned behind square on the leg and quick running enables them to take a second
tries to repeat the stroke but misses
finds the close fielder on the leg side
that one kept really low, a semi appeal for leg before as Mashud tried to work the ball into the off
up in the blockhole and squeezed out
again Rasel spars at the ball and misses

the innings ends with a diving catch. Rasel aimed to clip the ball to leg but only got a leading edge which lobbed high into the covers. It was probably Lara's catch but there was a marked lack of calling and in the end Samuels races in from backward point, diving  forward full length to catch the ball a foot off the ground

inn2.comm: wide of off stump and left well alone
straight and full, and sturdily defended
outside off again, left alone again
beaten, and kept low. Gayle looks bemused and confused
a fraction low again? Either way, it's a dot
and defended on off stump to complete a tidy maiden
good length but wide of off stump, steered to cover
solid defensive push into the covers. Steady start from Bangladesh's bowlers
a definite hint of swing as Chanderpaul fends this one off off stump
right on the money again. Chanderpaul wanders down the pitch for a word with his partner
lovely shot, just a firm push with impeccable timing. Whistles through the covers for the first runs of the innings
more swing as the ball tails from leg to leg-and-middle, and is pushed towards midwicket
good bowling, short of a length and tight to the stumps, just eludes Gayle's edge
definitely kept lower this time, and Gayle is looking a bit uncomfortable in these early exchanges
squeezed into the leg side
jabs down late on a wicket-to-wicket delivery. Would have been stone-dead but for the massive inside-edge that stifles the appeal
escapes the strike with a dab behind square
short and outside off stump, no stroke offered
outside off stump and dead-batted through gully
bosh! Lovely swing through the line, eludes all the fielders as it whistles through midwicket
another overstep. Careless stuff from Rasel
shovelled into the leg-side, good running
short and wide, but an attempted cut is mistimed
tighter line, and no overstep either
good areas, as Monty Panesar - among others - might say
shorter in length but the same result. A good recovery after a poor start to the over
full length and strikes the pads, and a hugely optimistic appeal from the bowler. All three sticks were visible when Gayle was hit
keeps low again. Mashrafe is skidding it through very effectively
it's a struggle out there for the usually free-scoring Gayle
wicket-to-wicket once again, and the bowler fields in his followthrough
but there's width this time, and the ball is leathered behind point for four. In theory it was a catchable height, but in practice it was past the fielder before he could blink
Gayle brings out his nine-iron to loft one into the outfield. He's starting to find his range, ominously for Bangladesh
good length on off stump, firm push back to the bowler
no rush from the Windies openers
too straight from Rasel, and this one is clipped firmly through the leg-side. Hauled up inside the rope as West Indies push on
back on a good line and length. Gayle has to be patient
wanted to attack but the ball wasn't quite there. Awkward jabbed defence
that one was in the slot though! Effortless smear over midwicket
right on the money. Good bowling so far
awkwardly played with one hand off the bat, but gets a single to third man
an expert nurdle to a ball that was a fraction too straight. Whipped with a full body action through fine leg
better line and respectfully played
nice delivery, short of a length and lifting, and nips back a fraction too. Left alone with a late readjustment
guided onto a good length with a touch of away-swing. Defended
in the right area once again, and a pushed drive can't beat the field
defended again. No need for dramatics from West Indies' openers
wide of off stump and left well alone
turned off the pads but straight to the man at short midwicket
a good and timely maiden for Bangladesh. They haven't given up hope yet
wide of off stump, left alone again
respectfully watched. These two are bowling well, but time for some spin perhaps?
good carry through to the keeper, and another valuable dot-ball
nice line and length, just in that corridor outside off stump. Left alone with a flourish this time
curving into the pads, and defended out to midwicket
a beauty - kept low, which helped, but Chanderpaul was comprehensively beaten outside off
left alone outside off stump. A pattern developing here!
well, that's broken the mould! Steps down the track and eases the ball on the up through long-on. Cracking shot!
more runs as Gayle picks the gap
too straight, and flipped down to fine leg
good line and length, seams past the bat
too wide this time, and clattered through point - lovely stroke!
beauty! Perfect line, length and seam movement, beat everything
another couple to the total
square-drive, fielded at point
tight line to finish and stoutly defended back down the pitch
emphatically battered through the covers. Welcome to the game!
turned out to the leg-side
dabbed into the off side
leisurely push down the ground and an ambled single
solid recovery after that first ball. End of a tidy over
lovely strike, beautiful back-foot drive through point
clipped off the pads, down to fine leg
firmly into line and pushed back to the bowler
handy nip off the seam as Chanderpaul is struck on the pad. Squeaked appeal, but nothing serious
drifting onto leg stump this time, and turned away for one more to the total
leg-side again, but Gayle can't capitalise. And that completes the over
hint of an appeal as Chanderpaul shapes to pull, but too high
nudged away for one to bring Gayle back onto strike
bat and pad together in a firm defensive push
Bangladesh will be happy to trade in singles while the powerplays are in action
and a nice loopy delivery concludes the over
dabbed down to third man for a couple
good flight, but bowling over the wicket so not much of an attacking line
slightly leg-side, might have been an edge? It was a fumble at any rate
good loop
push through mid-on to finish the over.
Gayle nicked that one and in and out of  Mashud's gloves. That's his second drop and about as simple as it can get for a keeper
casually driven to long on
half-heartedly driven back to the bowler
flicked square on the leg side
fired down the leg side and well taken by Mashud. That's the kind of ball that can get a wicket as the batsman overbalances
again leg side, this time Gayle turns it just behind square and ambles a single
better end to the over as Chanderpaul defends
down the leg side once again
Gayle looking a bit bogged down at the moment
good line and Gayle had to block
Gayle waited for that one, and then punched it up to long-on off the back foot
Rafique's leg-side line allows Chanderpaul to milk singles into the gap at square leg
Rafique overcompensated and overpitched, Gayle unleashes a textbook off drive wide of extra cover
Chanderpaul played for spin that wasn't there and was left groping at air
steered square on the leg side
driven straight, Razzak doesn't gather it cleanly and the batsmen canter for a single
neat line, no chance of a run
guided behind square on the off but once more to the fielder
great respect there and cautiously defended
and that's followed with a booming drive which he edges and the ball arcs close to the man at short third man, but not close enough
Chanderpaul is again beaten playing for spin that's not there
neatly placed into the leg side
Gayle waits and punches the ball down tp long on
Chanderpaul does likewise and that gives him the time to place the ball between fielders on the leg side and scurry through for a single
pushed through on off stump, blocked
again a tight line keeps Chanderpaul under wraps
strays slightly to leg and that gives Chanderpaul the freedom to find the gaps
back on his off-stump line
a tad shorter and pushed up to long on
a good ball to end the over
Gayle tries to guide it behind square on the off
Gayle cramped for room
Rafique tightening the screw with a good line
on the button once more
join the dots ...
Rafique drifts one a bit off line and Chanderpaul flicks it between square leg and midwicket
picked off for one. Razzak can't afford to give so many singles away
... but he does the same again
paddled to leg but not into a gap
much the same but once more to the fielder
much better line as the over progressed
squirted to short third man
extra bounce surprised Gayle and the ball took him on the glove
patted back to the bowler
loose drive to extra cover
blocked with no real effort
flicked off the back foot to deepish mid on. Although he has come in a few yards he still can't prevent the one from that shot
milked the single with time to pick the gap
optimistic appeal as Chanderpaul tries to flick it to leg and misses. Taufel looks unimpressed
that one bounced a little more and that surprised Chanderpaul
punched to extra cover
well bowled and a good comeback after another loose start
Gayle has gone into something of a doze ...
blocked again. He looks to be playing himself out of form
plopped wide of mid on
dragged down, short and wide enough for Chanderpaul to cut with power dead square for four
Rafique back on the mark
Chanderpaul happy to block again after a productive over
Gayle tries to swipe the ball over midwicket, misses, and Mashud barks a late appeal once he has checked the ball is in his gloves
back into his shell, Gayle takes the less violent alternative and taps the ball to mid on
given width, he plays a lovely cover drive with mimimal effort
no room to repeat the shot
floated up,  Chanderpaul has to check and dig it out in a rather ungainly manner
driven crisply and long off has to scurry round to field. Two runs brings him his fifty
blocked again
vintage Gayle. Overpitched and flicked with no effort over midwicket for six
banged a bit uppishly past the bowler and up to long on. Gayle looks as if he might be about to chance his arm after a period of quiet reflection
accurate start, on the spot
again there or thereabouts
Gayle content to see if Hasan has anything up his sleeve
too short and worked to leg. Gayle a bit surprised by some extra llft and he ended up playing that with just his top hand
a decent first over, but not really threatening
Gayle uses his feet, takes two steps down the track and smacks the ball over the ropes and onto the roof of the stand at long on
pushed up to long off for one
blocked
driven up the ground
same ball, similar shot, same result
Chanderpaul pushes the ball to mid on, sees he the fielder is slow to respond and calls Gayle for a single ... Gayle a bit dozy himself and ends up having to get his skates on
blocked
blocked again. No need to do anything else at this stage
a bit more aggression as the ball is cracked to extra cover
punched to long on
Gayle treats that with respect
once more long on is called into action
on leg stump, and an effortless pushed on-drive, perfect balance and timing, superb strike!
a bit of a mow this time from Gayle. I sense he wants a swift conclusion!
that'll help! Lovely full-blooded drive down the ground, rockets into the fence
this is majestic stuff from Gayle, who has set his sights on another century. A firm cover-drive blasts through the infield
bosh! The wheels are coming off for Bangladesh as Gayle belts his fourth four of the over, through midwicket this time. A swift denouement is suddenly in prospect
another big swish, but this time it isn't timed, and square-leg fields with relief
another swish, and another miss
good riposte from the bowler
one more to the total
Chanderpaul returns the strike. In-ter-est-ing-ly, Cricinfo's chief statto, Martin Williamson, points out that Chanderpaul had made 43 when Gayle had made 49 ...
the race is on
another to Gayle's total. The fight has gone out of Bangladesh now
and that's a horrible wide, barely lands on the cut strip
blam! That one is vaaaast! A huge swing of the bat and that's landed on the stadium roof! Clean over long-on to move into the nineties
another horrible wide. Is Aftab trying to deny Gayle his hundred?
width again, but toe-ended over the covers for another couple
a big smear across the line, but under-edged behind the stumps
still no fifty for Chanderpaul ...
more width, and dabbed to backward point
and there it is. His 40th ODI fifty. Well played Shivnarine
now, can Gayle get the five runs he needs? Only nine to play with ...
there's one of them, pushed down the ground for a jogged single
his partner blocks out the final ball of the over to aid Gayle's cause
biding his time so far
pushed out to mid-on
down the track, but beaten in flight and defended into the covers
a slight fumble from the bowler, and one more to the total. Three needed for his hundred
studious block from Chanderpaul
dead-ball singled by umpire Bowden as Chanderpaul takes off for a couple as the ball deflects off his thigh pad
driven down the ground, but only one run on offer. Talk about taking the cautious route to victory!
dabbed into the leg-side, an easy two on offer, but a jogged one is all they opt for
"We'll get em in singles, lad," as Wilfred Rhodes and George Hirst once said
this is one-day cricket at its most riveting. No, really ...
and there it is at last! Gayle's 13th one-day hundred is completed with a drive down to long-on. Well played that man. It wasn't easy at the start, but it's been effortless towards the end
Chanderpaul returns the strike, as the runs required are chiselled away
and that's the victory! Appropriately enough, it's Gayle who wraps things up with his 11th four of the innings, to finish unbeaten on 104.
